channel.title: Android on Ted's notes
channel.description: Recent content in Android on Ted's notes

item.title: Activities and Layouts
item.description: Most programs need an entry point or a beginning routine where all execution begins. Even the lowly “Hello World” in Java requires a static void main as an entry point. Android programs are the same, it also needs it’s own version of the “function main”. But the entry point of an Android program isn’t a literal function, and its also not called “main”, — it’s a bit more complicated than that.
